item.title: Kabul add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "Let us rise up and be thankful, for if we didn't learn a lot at least we learned a little, and if we didn't learn a little, at least we didn't get sick, and if we got sick, at least we didn't die; so, let us all be thankful." -- Buddha

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "My task, which I am trying to achieve is, by the power of the written word, to make you hear, to make you feel--it is, before all, to make you see." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Peace begins with a smile.." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Kabul add a quote by W. Draanen
item.description: "Some of us get dipped in flat, some in satin, some in gloss. But every once in a while you find someone who's iridescent, and when you do, nothing will ever compare." -- W. Draanen

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "The timeless in you is aware of life's timelessness. And knows that yesterday is but today's memory and tomorrow is today's dream." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description:
"A question.
So what are people supposed to do if they want to avoid a collision (thud!) but still lie in the field, enjoying the clouds drifting by, listening to the grass grow—not thinking, in other words? Sound hard? Not at all. Logically, it’s easy. C’est simple. The answer is dreams. Dreaming on and on. Entering the world of dreams, and never coming out. Living in dreams for the rest of time.
In dreams you don’t need to make any distinctions between things. Not at all. Boundaries don’t exist. So in dreams there are hardly any collisions. Even if there are, they don’t hurt. Reality is different. Reality bites.
Reality, reality." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "One day you will ask me which is more important? My life or yours? I will say mine and you will walk away not knowing that you are my life." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and to melt into the sun? And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "I have learned silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind; yet strange, I am ungrateful to these teachers." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need. " -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"Sonnet XVII
I do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz, or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off. I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul.
I love you as the plant that never blooms but carries in itself the light of hidden flowers; thanks to your love a certain solid fragrance, risen from the earth, lives darkly in my body.
I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you straightforwardly, without complexities or pride; so I love you because I know no other way than this:
where I does not exist, nor you, so close that your hand on my chest is my hand, so close that your eyes close as I fall asleep. " -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I want To do with you what spring does with the cherry trees." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "But I love your feet only because they walked upon the earth and upon the wind and upon the waters, until they found me." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair. Silent and starving, I prowl through the streets. Bread does not nourish me, dawn disrupts me, all day I hunt for the liquid measure of your steps.
I hunger for your sleek laugh, your hands the color of a savage harvest, hunger for the pale stones of your fingernails, I want to eat your skin like a whole almond.
I want to eat the sunbeam flaring in your lovely body, the sovereign nose of your arrogant face, I want to eat the fleeting shade of your lashes,
and I pace around hungry, sniffing the twilight, hunting for you, for your hot heart, Like a puma in the barrens of Quitratue." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kabul add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?" -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "Doubt everything. Find your own light." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "Your purpose in life is to find your purpose and give your whole heart and soul to it" -- Buddha

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description:
"It is like a lighted torch whose flame can be distributed to ever so many other torches which people may bring along; and therewith they will cook food and dispel darkness, while the original torch itself remains burning ever the same. It is even so with the bliss of the Way.
[<i>Sutra of 42 Sections</i>]" -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kabul add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
